bibl.title: Letter from Landon Reed to Philip Showalter Hench, December 22, 1947

div1.p: Reed thanks Hench for the candy, discusses family news, and requests a copy of Hench's talk at the University of Virginia.

div1.head: Letter from Landon Reed to Philip Showalter Hench, December 22, 1947
div1.p:
Thank you so very much
for the delicious candy from
Reyneers-I really think
they make the best in the
country and we have all en-
joyed it so much- and will
be eating it and thinking of you
for the Christmas season -

Lawrence & I both wanted to
thank you also for your letter
and most interesting pictures
taken at the War College-
I think they are excellent
of you both and we are
so glad to have them-
Blossom is coming down
Sat. to spend Sunday with
Mrs. Stanley for the grand -
child's Christening- I am
sorry she can not come to
us for a visit but is obliged
to get back to Mrs. Reed.
It is so dreary for her there
in the winter and Mrs. Reed
continues in the same state
of sleeping nearly all the
time-

I am sure you and Mrs Hench
will have a wonderful Christmas
with those lovely children
to make things gay & lively-
If you have a spare copy of
your University of Virginia speech
could I have one to send my
daughter? With our best wishes
to you and Mrs Hench for a
Merry Christmas & thanking you
again so much-
